title: spack install fails with AttributeError
body:
I came across this error first, when trying to build a custom made spack package for one of our own modules. There it occurred once I added 
```
depends_on('py-numpy')
depends_on('py-scipy')
```
to the package.py file. So running ```spack install py-sbs``` completed without these two lines, but obviously it failed at runtime. So I did a ```spack uninstall py-sbs```, added the two lines to the package.py and did a ```spack install py-sbs```
This then failed with a python traceback like the one below. After doing a ```spack clean py-sbs```, ```spack purge -a``` and a ```spack reindex```, the install went through.

Now I'm seeing the error message below when trying to install ```py-matplotlib```. I'm not entirely sure how I "fixed" it for our own package. Can you provide me with any hints of where this originates at? I haven't touched py-matplotlib's package.py.

Any help would be greatly appreciated.

```

[hd_wv385@uc1n996 git]$ spack install py-matplotlib

    return_val = command(parser, args)
```
